description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Higher quality programmes through results-based management and improved accountability of results.

Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - public finance management for Health
Multisector aid for basic social services
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for mostdisadvantaged children.
No. of States with specific modules and training plans on children's issues for PRIs

target.value: 2017:15 States ( Bihar, UP, MP, Raj, Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Assam, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka, AP, T Nadu, W Bengal, Kerala )

actual.value: 2014:Capacity building initiatives underway in Assam and West Bengal. Modules developed in Kerala, Maharashtra, and under development in Rajasthan, Jharkhand, Odisha, and training underway in Bihar,Jharkhand, Kerala. Odisha, Maharashtra, Rajasthan. Module on decentralized training which was finalized in

title.narrative: No: of districts with functional planning and monitoring systems established to support district planning (for e.g. DPMUs)

actual.value: 2014:Five states (Odisha, Maharashtra, MP, Rajasthan and West Bengal) have functional DPMUs in close to 40 districts. Like Odisha with a DPMU in every district, Maharashtra state Government has taken a policy decision to establish a DPMU in every district. Similarly, in Gujarat, every district will have

title.narrative: Extent to which sectoral plans reflect children's issues discussed in Gram Sabhas/ panchayat committees.

baseline.value: sectoral plans at the district level are not based on community demands

target.value: 2017:sectoral plans in 14 districts use community demands for planning purposes

actual.value: 2014:The review of Gram Panchayat (GP) plans in Kerala to understand how children's issues are addressed has yielded positive lessons. Gram panchayat based planning initiatives have been rolled out in four states. Resource kits, tools and modules have been developed in five states to support development
